definitions: A thin, flat strip of wood or other material, especially one of a series that overlap or are arranged side by side, as in a fence or a Venetian blind.
A movable aerodynamic surface on the leading edge of an aircraft wing that can be extended to increase lift at low speeds.
examples: The fence was made of wooden slats.
He adjusted the slats on the blinds.
The aircraft deployed its slats for landing.
